selected_quotes: #HITECH Act drove huge gains in #hospital #ehr adoption #healthreform by @j_r_a_m + @ashishkjha in @Health_Affairs
Our paper w the brilliant prolific @j_r_a_m. Did HITECH really drive EHR adoption? Yup. Now the hard part: using them t…
Researchers say HITECH Act drove hospital #EHR adoption, could serve as a model for other tech: (@Health_Affairs
The terrific part of Obamacare that gets very little credit
A research shows a substantial benefit of the #HITECH to driving adoption rate of #EHR in US. #healthcare

citation.abstract: The extent to which recent large increases in hospitals' adoption of electronic health record (EHR) systems can be attributed to the Health Information Technology for Economic and Clinical Health (HITECH) Act of 2009 is uncertain and debated. Because only short-term acute care hospitals were eligible for the act's meaningful-use incentive program, we used national hospital data to examine the differential effect of HITECH on EHR adoption among eligible and ineligible hospitals in the periods before (2008-10) and after (2011-15) implementation of the program. We found that annual increases in EHR adoption rates among eligible hospitals went from 3.2 percent in the pre period to 14.2 percent in the post period. Ineligible hospitals experienced much smaller annual increases of 0.1 percent in the pre period and 3.3 percent in the post period, a significant difference-in-differences of 7.9 percentage points. Our results support the argument that recent gains in EHR adoption can be attributed specifically to HITECH, which suggests that the act could serve as a model for ways to drive the adoption of other valuable technologies.
citation.publisher:
Project HOPE - The People-to-People Health Foundation,
                    Inc.
citation.title: HITECH Act Drove Large Gains In Hospital Electronic Health Record Adoption

news.title: Program that paid hospitals to adopt electronic records delivers dramatic results
news.summary: Incentives paid to hospitals to implement electronic health records appear to have paid off, with adoption rates 8 percentage points higher per year over five years for those that were eligible for the payments compared with those that were not…

news.title: HITECH Act drove EHR adoption
news.summary: Annual EHR adoption rates among eligible and ineligible hospitals increased after the 2009 Health Information Technology for Economic and Clinical Health Act went into effect, according to a study in Health Affairs.

news.title: Researchers: HITECH Act was a driving force behind EHR adoption
news.summary: An incentive program established under the HITECH Act in 2009 was a primary driver behind EHR adoption in hospitals across the country, according to a new study.

news.title: Health Affairs: MU Program Led to Spike in Hospitals’ EHR Adoption Rates
news.summary: Electronic health record (EHR) adoption rates in hospitals increased by an average of 3.2 percent annually in the period before implementation of meaningful use (MU) incentives.
